isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1991 - OPERATION - POWER SOURCE

svcsubproc.title: Without Kysor Engine Shutdown
svcsubproc.para: The PT Pacer Control Unit (PCU) harness is connected to the fuel shutoff solenoid terminal, which receives ignition power from fuse F4 (20 AMP).

svcsubproc.title: With Kysor Engine Shutdown
svcsubproc.para: During the 30-second start period, the Kysor Control Module controls delivery of ignition voltage to the PCU and the fuel shutoff solenoid.

step1.para: When the key switch is turned to the ON position, ignition power (circuit 19A) is delivered to the Kysor Control Module at terminal 1.

When the starter is engaged (with key or starter button), circuit 19B delivers power to the Kysor Control Module (terminal 2) and the 30-second delay is activated, closing the switch between terminals 1 and 3. With the Kysor Control Module switch between terminals 1 and 3 closed, current is delivered on circuit 19M, to activate the Kysor relay. With the relay activated, ignition power is delivered (circuit 19D) to the fuel shutoff solenoid and to the PT Pacer Control Module.
After the 30-second start interval, the Kysor Control Module switch (between terminals 1 & 3) opens and the ignition power source to the PCU and fuel shutoff solenoid from the Kysor relay is cut off.

Normally, within the 30-second time delay when the power to the fuel solenoid is controlled by the Kysor Control Module, the engine will have more than five PSI of oil pressure and control will be turned over to the alarmstat and pressurestat control system. Circuit 19H from the alarmstat supplies the voltage to the fuel shutoff solenoid after the 30-second delay period has ended and sufficient oil pressure is available to close the NO (normally open) contact in the pressurestat.

svcsubproc.para: In the event of low oil pressure (less than 5 PSI) or high engine coolant temperatures (higher than 225 degrees F), the power to the fuel shutoff solenoid is cut off, which will shut down the engine to prevent engine damage.
